comments:
Strange error when moving a source with a deactivated breakpoint from a named 
package to a !default package!. Strange, because it's hard to get it 
reproducable.

20011219 JDK 131

Steps:
Open eclipse. Open preferences - java - check use src/bin folder.
Create new Java-project MoveTest.
Create new package A.
Create new Class A in package a. (check create main)
Add a std statement

package A;

public class A {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println("");
	}
} 

Set breakpoint in main.
Open debug perspective. Set this breakpoint enabled = false.
Open java perspective. Drag class A to folder src and drop.
Error message Internal Error appears.

Log: Thu Jan 10 14:21:42 CET 2002
4 org.eclipse.jdt.core 969 A.java does not exist.
Log: Thu Jan 10 14:21:42 CET 2002
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Thu Jan 10 14:21:42 CET 2002
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 Failed to execute runnable 
(java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid range argument)
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable 
(java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid range argument)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1887)
	at 
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1385)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1203)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:815)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:798)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:82
1)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:502)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:362)

There are other errors as well, while trying to get an working example. But i've 
not so much time to work it out.
It can happen, that there is a breakpoint of a moved source still in in the 
properties editor at debug perspective. Changing a poperty will result in an 
error.
Strange too, is that you can do the dragging between 2 named packages without 
problems. An if you move the class A without breakpoint from A to default and 
back, and try the same with an activated breakpoint it works (perhaps something 
is cached?)

Martin, i cannot reproduce it on the latest integration build (20020205)
can you maybe give it a try on the lastest integration or the next stable and 
reopen if see it again?
thanks

Did a test with 20020125. All seems ok, as the breakpoints are removed when 
moving a class. No very polite but effective. So works for me too.
for the disappearing breakpoints you might be interested in bug#7552
